servinfo.title: Surge – Engine power variation under steady throttle or cruise. Feels like vehicle speeds up and down with no change in accelerator pedal
servinfo.ptxt: Perform troubleshooting referring to the followings when ECM has detected no DTC and no abnormality has been found in Visual Inspection:M16A and J20A and Engine Basic Inspection:M16A and J20A .

condition.ptxt: Surge – Engine power variation under steady throttle or cruise. Feels like vehicle speeds up and down with no change in accelerator pedal

ps.ptxt: Leaky or loosely connected high-tension cord (for M16A engine)

ptxt.intxref: High-Tension Cord Removal and Installation (M16A):M16A and J20A

ps.ptxt: Faulty spark plug (excess carbon deposits, improper gap, burned electrodes, etc.)
Kinky or damaged fuel hose and lines

ptxt.intxref: Mass Air Flow (MAF) and Intake Air Temperature (IAT) Sensor Inspection:M16A and J20A
Fuel Injector Circuit Check:M16A and J20A
Electric Throttle Body Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection:M16A and J20A

ps.ptxt: Faulty accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly

ptxt.intxref: Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Inspection:M16A and J20A
